intro: Maughania philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine maughania, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests. Its botanical significance lies in its role as an endemic species contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
